disclaimerText: This forecast is intended to provide information on expected pollution levels in areas of significant public exposure. It may not apply in very specific locations close to unusually strong or short-lived local sources of pollution.

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Saturday 2 April to end of Monday 4 April GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Air is expected to arrive from the North Sea throughout the day. Cold, but with sunny spells and a chance of wintry showers expected on Saturday. <br/>Frosty start on Sunday, then mainly dry day with periods of sunshine. Rain will arrive overnight into Monday, which should clear in the afternoon. The air will start arriving from the north west by Monday.<br/><br/>Overall air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/><br/>

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Tuesday 5 April to end of Wednesday 6 April GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Tuesday is forecast to be mainly dry and warm. Rain will arrive overnight into Wednesday. Some periods of sunshine and further rain throughout the day. Clean air arriving from the Atlantic, strong winds will aid dispersion of local emissions.  <br/><br/>Overall air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/><br/>
